page.title: 12M25
page.content: For over a decade the{M25}has been carved out of the countryside in this area. First the stretch from Maple Cross to Watford opened about 8 years ago, and now the stretch to by-pass Watford and join up with the eastern section at South Mimms. A traffic census was carried out on the first section and it was found that around mid-day 4200 vehicles were using the road in both directions in a ratio of approximately 3 to 1 cars to heavy goods vehicles. {ASBESTOS WORRY} When the workmen were digging out the earth for the main M25 route they discovered some asbestos.Langleybury people signed a petition to show their concern.This type of asbestos is not as dangerous as the blue dust asbestos and an M25 foreman said it had been buried in a pit 60 feet deep nearby.
